hypothesis_content.title: Stress-to-Bull Regime Transition via BTC Dominance Reversal
hypothesis_content.statement: When the market transitions from STRESS to BULL regime, a sharp 3-day decline in BTC dominance (>5% drop) while BTC price holds above its 20-day moving average signals imminent altcoin outperformance, with ETH/BTC ratio rising >8% over the following 10 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: STRESS regimes typically see flight to BTC safety. Transition to BULL with declining dominance suggests capital rotation into alts. The 20-day SMA filter ensures BTC isn't in breakdown. Historical data shows ETH/BTC tends to mean-revert upward after extreme BTC dominance peaks during regime transitions.
entry_conditions: Regime transitions from STRESS to BULL (confirmed by FjordHQ regime classifier)
BTC dominance drops >5% over 3 consecutive trading days

exit_conditions.take_profit: ETH/BTC ratio increases by 8% from entry
exit_conditions.stop_loss: ETH/BTC ratio decreases by 4% from entry

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of signals result in ETH/BTC ratio declining or failing to achieve 5%+ gain within 10 days during confirmed BULL regimes.
